implementation.useCase: Integration of Claude 3 model family (Haiku, Sonnet, and Opus) into Cody, Sourcegraph's AI coding assistant, to provide context-aware chat, inline completions, inline editing, and custom commands that help developers write and understand code faster by analyzing the entire codebase.
implementation.problem: Developers need to accelerate software development by having AI tools that can understand entire codebases in context rather than isolated code snippets, while balancing speed, intelligence, and cost.
implementation.integrationMethod: Claude models are integrated into Cody's chat and custom command features, with different models available based on subscription tier

metrics.metric: increase in code insert rate (users taking Cody's suggestions and inserting them directly into their files)
metrics.sourceText: Since rolling out Claude 3 Sonnet as the default model to Cody Free users, Sourcegraph has seen an approximate 75 percent increase in code insert rate; Cody users are taking almost twice as much code from Cody's suggestions and inserting it directly into their files, which indicates an increase in code quality.

metrics.metric: delivery of chat and command responses compared to previous model
metrics.sourceText: Claude 3 Sonnet delivers chat and command responses at twice the speed of its predecessor, which further accelerates the coding process.

metrics.metric: of Cody Pro users switched their default model to the new Claude 3 models in the month following launch
metrics.sourceText: Sourcegraph also saw that roughly 55 percent of Cody Pro users switched their default model to the new Claude 3 models in the month following the launch.

metrics.metric: the speed of Anthropic's previous model, Claude 2.1
metrics.sourceText: Claude 3 Sonnet serves as the default model for the free version of Cody, with improved coding abilities and two times the speed of Anthropic's previous model, Claude 2.1.

qualitativeBenefits.detail: Users are inserting more of Cody's suggestions directly into their files
qualitativeBenefits.sourceText: Cody users are taking almost twice as much code from Cody's suggestions and inserting it directly into their files, which indicates an increase in code quality.

qualitativeBenefits.detail: Claude 3 Opus provides near-perfect recall accuracy for large amounts of code context
qualitativeBenefits.sourceText: With the near-perfect recall accuracy of Claude 3 Opus, Cody gives developers even better results because it can understand large amounts of code context without missing key information.

qualitativeBenefits.detail: Claude 3 models can generate code without requiring manual intervention
qualitativeBenefits.sourceText: Claude 3 models excel at following instructions, generating production-ready code without requiring manual intervention or code snippets

qualitativeBenefits.benefit: Flexible model options for different needs
qualitativeBenefits.detail: Different Claude 3 models optimized for various use cases
qualitativeBenefits.sourceText: Optimized for different levels of speed and intelligence, each Claude 3 model excels at different functions within Cody while helping Sourcegraph keep its costs low without compromising quality.

technicalDetails.architecture: Cody integrates Claude 3 models to power features like codebase-aware chat, inline completions, inline editing, and custom commands. Claude 3 Sonnet is the default model for free users, while Pro and Enterprise users can access Opus, and Haiku is available for speed-critical use cases.
technicalDetails.promptEngineering: Not mentioned specifically, but the case study indicates they provide codebase context to Claude to enable accurate answers about private codebases
technicalDetails.scale: Claude 3 models have a 200K context window that Sourcegraph plans to leverage for bringing in additional context sources
